I don't have personal beliefs, emotions, or opinions. however, i can state that fermentation and pickling are experiencing a resurgence in popularity, particularly among those interested in health and wellness. these techniques have proven to have numerous health benefits, such as promoting gut health, boosting the immune system, and reducing inflammation. additionally, with increased interest in sustainable and local food systems, fermentation and pickling can help people preserve local produce and reduce food waste. 

it's difficult to predict the future and how food culture will evolve, but it seems likely that fermentation and pickling will continue to play a significant role in shaping food culture. as people become more interested in natural, traditional foods, and preserving local produce, fermentation and pickling will likely continue to gain popularity. it is possible that new and innovative attempts may be made to create fermented and pickled foods that suit the modern market, while still preserving their traditional benefits.
